name: Aaron Scribner
title: Code Artist
about: I thoroughly enjoy solving business problems through technology and strive in collaborative teams. I prefer to work in smaller Scrum teams in which the entire team is adept in all facets of the development lifecyle. I place an emphasis on creating clean and maintainable code to ensure the team is able to move efficiently as the needs of the business change.

duties.description: Responsible for Angular architecture
Set the technical direction for feature implementation
Mentored junior developers to follow best practices
Created Angular framework and patterns to increase the team efficiency
Led team to successful milestone for application demo at annual company conference
Collaborated with the UX designer to determine efficient paths forward when designing the UI
Collaborated with the other data and REST architect for designing application features
Create Nuget packages in .NET Core to support API development
Participated in Domain-Driven Design discussions
Communicated closely with the product owner to match the technical direction with that of the business
Was the technical lead for the the Angular and .NET Core solutions
Mentored other developers
Designed and implemented complex, multi-level data-grid display for stock trade information
Created the technical acceptance criteria for stories
Architected and led decisions for developing an AI-based insurance system
Implemented applications with Docker support for deployment to AWS
Worked closely with DevOps for consistent patterns with respect to our solution architecture for continuous integration and deployment
Implemented the full vertical stack to meet business needs
Integrated solutions with AWS cloud services
Key team member in major modernization effort across the entire architecture for the platform with a focus on the client-side technology
Responsible for implementing complex business logic in the front-end that is not handled server-side
Redesigned the UX per the business requirements with an immutable API layer
Wrote unit tests to cover the expected functionality and also speed up the development process
Integrated with a Mock API for UI development stability
Create the HTML/CSS per provided mockups
Participated in approving pull requests
